entry.title: Custom Key Bindings in MailMate
entry.content:
I have been using MailMate frequently. Personally, I would think it is a very geeky and one of the best wmail softwares in Mac. One of the strengths is, compared to other email clients, it is highly configurable. I have added one keybord binding to MailMate. The below is how I i did it:

  1. Create a folder in ~/Library/Application Support/MailMate/Resources/KeyBindings/
  2. Create a file called Special.plist
  3. Type file name Special in Custom Key Binding in Preferences.
  4. Put your keyboard binding in Special.plist. The below is my binding:

In my case, I use g+u to navigate to Uread folder. To make it work, you need to find mailbox UIUD. You can find it in ~/Library/Application Support/MailMate/Mailboxes.plist.

That is how I did it. I feel like MailMate is like Vim in email client softwares.

entry.title: Could Not Start Spork Server for RSpec
entry.content: Try to install Spork and Guard in order to run Rspec more efficiently. After installing both of them, I typed Guard. Then, the message Could not start Spork server for RSpec came out in terminal. In the end, I found out that when I shut down my VPN, the server started successfully. I guess it took too long to run the code with VPN.

entry.title: Using Pinboard in Command Line
entry.content:
I have been using Pinboard for a while. It is a very powerful bookmarking service with minimum interface. Now I can use CLI with pinboard. All I have to do is to install a gem and put a api token.

Install

gem install pinboard-cli

Place API

place it in ~/.pinboard-token

entry.title: How to Install Wget in Mac OS
entry.content:
Wget is a very powerful CLI tool. However, Mac doesn’t have it by default. There are several ways to install. The easiest way is to use homebrew to install. Of course, homebrew has to be installed beforehand. All you need to do is type one command line:

$ brew install wget

entry.title: Home Key on Macbook Pro
entry.content:
Mac app TaskPaper is my daily-use GTD app. I have digg the shortcut of TaskPaper. However, there were three shortcuts I could not figure out. They are home key and page up/down key. There are no suck keys on my Macbook pro keyboard. After posting my question on TaskPaper forum. someone answered my question:

Home key = command+fn+left arrow

page down/up=command+fn+down/up arrow

entry.content:

entry.title: Octoeditor
entry.content:
I have been using Octopress for a while. Since I started to learn Vim, I had been thinking how to integrate Vim with Octopress. My idea is to creat, write, and upload a blog all in Vim. In this way, I don’t need to switch between termainal and Vim. After searching for a proper plug-in, I foud a plug-in called Octoeditor. With this plug-in, you can do it all in Vim with sevaral shortcuts. Here is my shortcuts:

Crate a blog map <Leader>on :OctopressNew<CR> List all blogd map <Leader>ol :OctopressList<CR> Rake Generate map <Leader>og :OctopressGenerate<CR> Rake Deploy map <Leader>od :OctopressDeploy<CR>

entry.title: Vim Swap File
entry.content:
I have started to learn how to use Vim recently. The first thing I need to learn is to use Vim to write my blog in Octopress. The one advatage of using Vim is that you fire up Vim inside Termial. Itmight make workflow easier. However. when I finished my article and deploy rake. Here error came.

The solution is to put `set noswapfile’ in .vimrc. Disable swapfile.

entry.title: Vimperator
entry.content:
I had been using Chrome for a while. However, I found Chrome occupies too many memory. So, I decided to switch back to FireFox which I had used it for 6 years.

When I learned how to use FireFox again, I discovered a extension called “Vimperator”. It can make FireFox Vim-like browser. At this moment, I am not familiar with Vim. But I decided to give Vimperator a shot. It did lead me to another world. Now I can not live without Vimperator when I browse the internet. At the beginning, it was difficult to use Vimperator. But the more I practice, the more efficiency I am. Now I am interested to learn more about Vim and its design philosophy. I am glad that I tried Vimperator. I find Vim’s concept is everywhere. It is a skill set for long-term use.

entry.title: Workbench
entry.content:
Drupal is a very powerful CMS and known for its flexibility. Due to its flexibility, it has been very developer-friendly. However, the interface of Drupal CMS could be very confusing to site administrators who don’t have technical background.

It always takes us time to teach our clients how to publish and edit pages. Due to complexity of Drupal CMS, it is easy for our clients to be lost in the backend.

Workbench is a great module for administrators who often publish and edit pages. With Workbench, user can see recent articles he/she has published and edited under one page. It becomes very easy to manage articles.
